All time classic first person shooter, whose brilliant pacing and spectacular setpieces are rivalled only by its sequel. The game that put VALVe on the map, Half-Life is still a blast to play. I love the survival-horror feel of this game, which HL2 sort of lacked (aside from Ravenholm), and the massive arsenal Freeman builds up throughout his journey. As well, the enemies you meet are more varied (who can forget the Blast Pit sequence and first encounter with the Garg). While the source remake Black Mesa is great too, nothing beats the original (nostalgia might be something to do with that). It's outdated for sure (jumping puzzles, platforming, blocky graphics) but don't let that stop you from playing one of the best action games out there.

Half Life is and will always will be the greatest FPS in history. With a campaign three times as long as call of duties and obsurdly fun multiplayer, no other game will come as close except it's sequel

Sinceramente pienso que nací en la época equivocada, me gustaría haber vivido este gran juego de salida y ver en "directo" como le llueven premios totalmente merecidos.

Para analizar este juego hay que tener en cuenta que se hizo con la tecnología de hace casi 20 años, no se puede ser duro en el tema gráficos.

Hablando de los gráficos, utiliza el motor goldsrc, que significa que lo que vienen a ser las texturas y los polígonos por separado dan sidita. Antes de saltarme al cuello querido lector, observa ese "por separado", los escenarios son realmente buenos, son algo que no olvidarás nunca, como cuando entras en la cámara de pruebas. Las texturas son completamente planas, pero no da esa sensación, las texturas tienen un efecto de sombra para dar una sensación de profundidad, este juego tiene tantos pequeños detalles que lo hacen un enorme juego.

Todo, los teletransportadores, las misteriosas apariciones de G-Man, los alienígenas, los vortigaunts y su collar de control, el planeta Xen, el dispositivo de salto avanzado, el extremadamente dificil parkour, los headcrabs en los conductos de ventilación, los terroristas hijos de puta, la pistola de bichos, el arma experimental de rayos, la GRAN batalla contra el pobre jefe final.

En resumen, lo jugué pirata hace un par de años y me lo he comprado solo para hacer un poco más rica a Valve.

Un puto 10/10 si señor.

Ah the birth of the Half-Life series, a good one I must say. I really do enjoy this game as I have not played this on Steam but it is a very, very good game. Love the 1999 graphics and audio and I love how Half-Life is such a good game. You don't come across games like this often and I must say, opening a resonance cascade into another dimmension is pretty scary and having to escape to the surface was scary as well. Even for a game made in the 20th century! Yes, I do recommend this game if you have only played the sequel too, pick this up it will make so much more sense once you're plopped into into Half-Life 2 and so on. This is the beginning of a man and his crowbar, and the beginning of a new world as we know it.

Half-Life is my old love so I found this review kind of hard to put together, since I had to put aside my nostalgia and deliberate precisely on what makes Half-Life an excellent game, but here goes my best.

Half-Life is seemingly a classic FPS however back when It was released it was anything BUT, Half-Life was a frigging revolutionary game that defied FPS standards while still preserving what makes FPS fun and good. And Half-Life IS fun, Its got a wide and diverse range of weapons and enemies (as well as some cool bosses) and some brilliant AI that still impresses me today.

But what really makes Half-Life a really stand out game is what it does that is different. Rather then going the way of a metal gear solid game valve opted for a really interesting minimal storytelling approach in which everything is witnessed through the gameplay, there are no cutscenes of any kind. The less is more approach works and instead of long pieces of poorly written dialogue the game lets you observe first hand the chaos and destruction in the aftermath of the Black Mesa Incident. It works and the atmosphere feels like the aftermath of some kind of horrible and ongoing disaster like a huricane or a Nuclear blast In which you must fight for your life throughout the game to escape.

Rather than explain everything to you Half-Life will show you a lot of things or occasionaly say things that may confuse you. This is because you are just one man and its impossible for you to comprehend the big picture, you are small and insignificant in this grand scheme going on and while you get vague hints throughout the game as to this bigger picture the game leaves you guessing which gives the game a large sense of a forboding and sinister mystery .

This game is built on atmosphere and while the graphics have aged a lot, it is still a breath taking experiance to witness the disaster and destruction of Black Mesa. The sounds and music are top notch and aid with this of course.

If you are one of the few people who has not played Half-Life yet I really suggest that you get around to it, you wont just have fun but I think It will probably influence your opinion on how Video Game stories and atmosphere should be handled in relation to gameplay.

An excellent game in its own right. Valves first masterpiece which inspired the sequels (HL2, Ep 1 & 2) and countless mods throughout the series, such as the acclaimed Team Fortress 2 and Portal.

The player starts of as a researcher in Black Mesa running late to work. After the Gordon Freeman, the character the player controls, reaches the test he is supposed to participate in he is immediately put to work. This has cataclysmic consequences, and Gordon Freeman is then forced to defend Black Mesa from an alien invasion and, eventually, the military, all the while being followed by the mysterious G-man.

In terms of gameplay, Half-Life is very simple. You have health and suit power, a variety of guns and hopeully some aim. Starting with a crowbar and ending with a laser, you will shoot your way through Black Mesa, solving simple puzzles and navigating sometimes complex coridoors.

The plot is simple yet effective, as is the gameplay. Overall, a very satisfying game, and worth checking out regardless of reviews, due to its impact.

For being from 1998, wow, just wow. Even this year, 2014, I have LOVED this game even more than Half-Life 2, this is one of those games that makes you look back and wonder "What happened to games like this?" "I like all the new games such as Titanfall, Wolfenstein, etc, but were did the simple shooters with an exellent story and plenty of shooting go, what happened to Half-Life? Will we ever see Half-Life 3?" Yes I do enjoy all the newer games like Titanfall and such, but this game though its from 1998, is still probably one of the best games I have ever played.  97/10 would play again + purchase 10 more times.

Собственно, для своего времени очень хороший шутер. Да и сейчас в него стоит поиграть не только для ознакомления, но и ради развлечения и много других причин. Сюжетная часть здесь стоит не на первом месте, но зато проста для понимания. Вы - физик Гордон Фримен, которой стал причиной страшной аварии, в ходе которой был открыт портал в параллельный мир, наполненный страшными существами, которые незамедлительно ворвались в наш мир и в быстром порядке захватили исследовательский комплекс "Чёрная меза". Начался ад. Существа уничтожили практически весь персонал, а те, кто сумел миновать их "зубы и когти", были расстреляны солдатами-чистильщиками. Повсюду трупы, кровь на стенах, следы разрушения, и страх. Страх того, что за углом может оказаться какая нибудь тварь (или твари), а патроны не бесконечные. Страх того, что вы в любой момент можете оказаться в смертельной ловушке, шанс выбраться их которой практически близок к нулю.

По сути, это шутер с элементами фантастики, который плавно перетекает в простой шутер. По сути, игра разделена на три части. Первая часть: вы, держа пистолет в руке, мечетесь по корридорам, отстреливая пришельцев и зомби. Вторая: вы, словно Шварцнеггер, крошите отряды спецназовцев и их технику (танки и вертолёты). Третья: снова возвращение к первой части, только уже в другой вселенной. Все эти три части гармонично связаны между собой прекрасной динамикой и атмосферой, а так же сюжетом, который ближе под конец превращается из "спастись, как можно быстрее" в "борьбу бобра с ослом".

Причём не стоит удивляться, что простой физик способен противостоять практически всем войскам армии, ибо разработчики снабдили его костюмом, который служит и бронежелетом, и фонариком, и противорациационным костюмом. 

Геймплей, несмотря на постоянные пострелушки, зачастую становится разнообразен. Просто так пройти из точки А в точку Б нельзя: вам обязательно надо уничтожить врагов, либо повернуть рычаг, либо сделать что нибудь другое. Всё это прибавляет к общей сложности игры, и играть становится порядком интереснее. 

Локации запоминающиеся, особенно последние в другой вселенной. 

Вердикт: достаточно динамичная, мрачная, сложная, атмосферная, да и просто запоминающаяся игра. Отличный пример SCI-FI в игровой вселенной.

20 hours flew by as I trudged gracelessly through the glorious saga that is Half-Life.  I picked up the Valve Complete Pack during the Autumn sale and decided to play the games chronologically as they were released.  Right after I finished HL, I opened up TF Classic and spent an hour chasing Homer Simpson around a modded map and getting absolutely pulverized - Alt + F4 for now.  I went back and started Opposing Force for more crowbar-infused madness.

My one and ONLY one complaint about Half-Life is pushing/dragging boxes around.  It's a small part of the game, but my god.

I know I'm adding nothing by reviewing a game that's already widely considered one of the best ever, but please get this game.

Half-Life had a huge impact during my childhood, and is responsible for introducing me to my love of first-person shooters as well as PC games in general. Back then, I've sunk so many hours into playing the campaign several times, simply for its rock solid gameplay, intricate level design and revolutionary use of scripted sequences to tell its story. The game's community also spawned a plethora of mods that give it so much longevity. 

This timeless classic pits you in the role of Gordon Freeman, a scientist at the Black Mesa Research Facility, who must escape after a scientific experiment gone wrong. You shoot a variety enemies, from aliens to gun-toting soldiers. In addition to your standard conventional weapons such as the pistol, shotgun and machine gun, there are also cool sci-fi weapons to tinker around with including the tau cannon, gluon gun, and the adorable snarks. 

If you love video games, you owe yourself to play this game at least once in your lifetime. A certified masterpiece.
Excelente clasico, recomendado 100%

Che cos'è un Capolavoro?

A mio avviso non son poche le caratteristiche che deve possedere un videogame per fregiarsi di tale titolo. Grafica, sonoro, giocabilità e longevità ben al di sopra la media sono solo la base, l'indispensabile per una pietra miliare dei videogame. La capacità di saper rivoluzionare quanto fatto fino ad ora serve davvero, e ad essa va aggiunto il talento di invecchiare così bene da essere sempre rigiocabile con piacere, anche a quindici o più anni di distanza. 

Halflife è tutto questo. Un must per gli amanti del FPS, per i retrogamers ed in generale per chiunque pensi che con un pc non si deve solo lavorare.

Half mı Life? Eğer oynamadıysanız kesinlikle ve kesinlikle oynayıp bitirmeniz gereken bir oyun. Hayır hayır korsan indirmeyin. Oynucaksanız Steam'den alın kardeşim hem ne güzel online'ı da var çok eğlenceli FPS oyun herkese tavsiye ederim görüntü kalitesi olarak berbat fakat her bölümünü heyecanla oynayacağınız, bazı yerlerinde headcrab (kafa yengeci) lere küfür edeceğiniz bir oyun.

The game that revolutionzed the FPS genre. How can it not be great?

Story: The story is about a middle-aged scientist, Gordon Freeman, who has signed up to work at the Black Mesa Research facility. After an experiment went [b]HORRIBLY[/b] wrong, Freeman must now fight his way through the enormous compunds of Black Mesa to survive. Later he is told that soldiers have arrived to rescue them, but is it really so?

Gameplay: The gameplay is fun and interesting, and was at the time different from most First-person shooters. Half-Life focused less on the guns and required more thinking to succed. This is a great thing. The guns are still there, and most of them are fun to use, like the Shotgun and Pistol. Overall, the gameplay is superb, and holds up well even today.

Music: The music is great, and fits the game perfectly. Some of the music feels creepy, like "Space Ocean" which plays after the disastrous experiment, and other pieces get you pumped, like "Drums and Riffs" which plays after you launch a rocket at a later part in the game.

Overall, Half-Life was great back 1998 when it came out, and is still great even to this day. Pick it up if you got the chance, you will by no means regret it.

EDIT: Given the new steam sale, i think this game deserves to win as while it may show some age by now, gameplay wise it's still jsut as fun as it was back when it was released. It has stood the test of time.

I finally got the chance to buy & play this amazing game in the steam exploration sale so I'll try my best to explain this game in my point of view.

Oh boy where to start well for starters this game is one of the main reasons Valve is highly respected & over 4 million gamers are still waiting for Half Life 3 including me, Gordon Freeman is a badass scientist that can fight off the military & a shitload of aliens, lots of weapons to choose from, the atmosphere is pretty spot on with the suspense of fighting off soldiers or just overall creepiness in Xen (the alien world), I could tell the game has had a lot of love because the game works fine on any PC & there's so many great things I can say about this game but I don't want to make an entire list of everything. G-man a.k.a Government Man (The slang is right here http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G-Man_%28slang%29 if you don't know what it means) interests me because of his mysterious behaviour & everyone still wants to know if he fights for good or evil but some things in life can't be answered but I don't know if we could all handle the truth.... if you really want more questions added I would suggest this video it gives out some good theories on G-Man & many others you can watch on youtube. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_HmxQi09brI

The game has few minor bugs but the game still holds out as one of the grandfathers of the FPS genre & still popular for a 16 year old game so my final verdict is to get this game. Don't forget keep some head crabs as souvenirs on your grand adventures in Black Mesa, Freeman's grandkids might want it for their school project or for bragging rights on how cool their grandpa was back in his scientific glory. (If you feel like I missed something feel free to leave feedback)

Bonus: This is a great video if you want G-Man & Nihilanth talked about at the same time https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nzkPO_nDdFU

Bonus 2: You should check out Black Mesa if you can find it http://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Black_Mesa:About_the_Mod

Here's a gameplay vid of the mod - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-kgO9el3eT4

Bonus 3: Here's a list of popular mods I found - http://www.moddb.com/games/half-life/mods?sort=rating-desc

Fun Fact: Cry Of Fear was originally a Half Life mod & in the beginning of the game it has a Half Life poster in one of the rooms 

The mod is on steam if you want to try it out http://store.steampowered.com/app/223710/

Still great, though age has not done it a great service, and it is more enjoyable as a cultural artifact.  

HL1 has several memorable moments, enjoyable combat, and challenging scenarios, but be prepared for a game hampered by old design methodology.  Checkpoints are very sparse, so be prepared to use quicksave often.  Enemy marines spam grenades like you wouldn't believe, often resulting in sudden, sometimes unfair, deaths.  The game is riddled with platforming sequences that can be best described as "not good".  Also Xen.  These are all minor complaints that mire an otherwise enjoyable game, however.

Also HD textures make the game worse.

No matter what year it is, Half Life will still be one of the greatest games of all time. I had never played this game before and i feel stupid for only playing it right now. It is an amazing game and i loved every moment i played the game. Yes the game hasnt aged well. You can tell from the start that it is a old game, but it works with the game because it gives it that old school feel and i am so glad they never tried to remake this game. For any one out there who hasnt played this game just go play it, it is one of those games you need to play at least once in your life. Dont worry how it looks or how long it is or is the combat any good, just play it. You will not regret it.

Fantastic. This game was a blast from start to finish and had me entertained and interested for my entire playthrough despite the game's age. The only real problem was the AI could be really stupid, but it wasn't a big enough issue to take away from me enjoying the game.
Come on, you haven't played this yet? It's a classic for a reason.
Amazing game, even if it's played in the old engine/grafics (because u can play HL1 as a mod for HL2, with source engine and better grafics). But still, OLD BUT GOLD.

One of the BEST and LEGEND FPS Game Ever Made.

I think diz game waz an positive experience and i reccomnd it for all races and religions. Good luck!

2014:

This is still a good game. The production values show through. The intro is legendary, and I found myself sucked in to the game more than most modern ones. I surprised myself by playing it for almost five hours straight, right off the bat. More than any other game in a while, in one go.

First, the bad: The polygon count is very low, so the graphics look very dinky at their worst. But thats about it for the low-lights.

Then the good: As I said, the plot and the pacing are solid. The game can draw you in if you let it. The graphics have been updated to some extent, so they are much better than when the game was first released, and with straight walls and square objects, the polygon count doesn't matter.

The controls are very responsive, and all the modern elements of an FPS are there, so nothing retro here except the graphics. I played it at easy, because that's my skill level, and found the campaign suitably challenging. So I can only assume that if you crank up the difficulty you can make the game very hard.

The campaign took me about twelve hours to complete, so that's a somewhat average amount of content, I guess.

So, overall, in my opinion, not just retro lolz, but a timeless gem.

La primera entrega de Half life;gran historia,motor gráfico y todo en general.
Obra maestra.
Lo único que canviaría serían los tiempos de carga.

Efsaneler unutulmaz !

Se você nunca jogou esse jogo, não pode se considerar um gamer. Não só foi o jogo que iniciou todo o gênero FPS como também é o melhor jogo de tiro do século passado. Posso ter só algumas horas de jogo na Steam, mas já zerei ele tantas vezes quanto se é possível zerar um jogo antes de comprá-lo na Steam. Se achar que os gráficos são ultrapassados e ruins, lembre-se de que Half-Life foi lançado 16 anos atrás.

Para mi un excelente juego sus Mods, sus modificaciones.
